nodes.text: A Kaleesh individual met with the Kaleesh General Grievous prior to his departure to fight in the renewed Huk War. Grievous bowed before the Kaleesh at a landing site, where the latter anointed him with red markings and called on his ancestors to watch over him.

A member of the Kaleesh species lived at the time of the renewed Huk War in circa 24 BBY.  The Yam'rii, a species derogatorily called the Huk by the Kaleesh, had received backing from the Galactic Republic and the Jedi in their war against the Kaleesh, in which Grievous had been a leader. After the Yam'rii tarnished several sacred Kaleesh burial grounds, Grievous discarded his offworld responsibilities and returned to his homeworld Kalee for vengeance. At a landing site along with his Izvoshra, elite Kaleesh warriors, Grievous knelt before the Kaleesh individual, who believed the Republic ignored Kaleesh appeals and favoured the Yam'rii.

The individual called Grievous the "last hope" for their people, annointing the general by drawing red markings across his face with a finger. The Kaleesh blessed Grievous, calling for the spirits of his ancestors to watch over him and his soldiers, to which the General retorted that he would be fine as long as his troop carrier, the Martyr, held together. The Kaleesh individual watched as Grievous took flight, though his starship crashed due to sabotage by the leaders of the Confederacy of Independent Systems, who wished to make the general into a cyborg for their own ends.

The Kaleesh individual had red skin and sharp white fingernails. The Kaleesh believed that the Republic and the Jedi Order showed favouritism towards the Yam'rii, and that Grievous was the species' remaining hope for justice. The individual also had spiritual beliefs, calling on Grievous' ancestors to bless him. The general also bowed before the Kaleesh to receive his blessing, even though Grievous was considered a demigod amongst his own people.

At the time of the meeting with Grievous the Kaleesh individual held a white crooked staff and a brown satchel. The Kaleesh wore a white robe, two white bracelets on each arm, had a head adorned with an animal skull.
The Kaleesh individual appeared in The Eyes of Revolution, a comic written and illustrated by Warren Fu that was published in Star Wars: Visionaries in 2005
